title: Wexford plane crash: First picture of flight instructor killed in double tragedy
text:

A flight instructor was one of two people killed in a plane crash in Ireland on Sunday.

Peter Tawse, 61, and 58-year-old John Finnan lost their lives in the Co Wexford smash just before 6pm, the Irish Mirror reports.

It’s believed the light aircraft exploded upon impact, shortly after take off.

Local councillor Michael Sheehan said: “Our thoughts and prayers are with the casualties and their families and our thanks to the emergency services involved.”

The Rollason Condor aircraft is thought to have taken off from a field in the Taghmon area, just minutes from where it crashed.

Mr Tawse had been teaching people to fly since 1982.

The experienced flier spent 15 years developing and running Waterford Regional Airport as manager from 1987 to 2002.

Police, fire brigade and Coast Guard attended the scene of the accident yesterday.

A police spokesman said: “Gardai and emergency services are currently at the scene of a light aircraft accident which occurred at Duncormick, Co Wexford, at approximately 5.45pm.

“Initial reports indicate that there are two casualties.

“The Air Accident Investigation unit are travelling to the scene and the Irish Aviation Authority have been notified.”
description: Peter Tawse, 61, and John Finnan, 58, were killed in the tragedy in Co Wexford over the weekend
